results.title: Fun factory
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This film tells of Mack Sennett’s rise from movie extra to king of comedy. It also looks at the style and the actors of the Mack Sennett studio, famous for its “Keystone Cops” films. Uses excerpts from films of the period.

results.title: Full time killer = Fulltime killer = Chuen jik sat sau
results.creator_credit: Milky Way Productions, Johnnie To, Andrew Lau and Ka-Fai Wai
results.brief_description: Two professional assassins engage in a battle of wits as they vie for the title of Asia’s number one hitman. Tok (Andy Lau), is an up-and-coming professional with an extravagant and flamboyant style, given to copying schemes of mass destruction from the movies and possessed of a diabolical wit. His antagonist is the Japanese-speaking O (Takashi Sorimachi), a discrete and efficient hitman who single-mindedly carries out his lethal tasks then fades into obscurity. The two men are preoccupied with the same woman, Chin (Kelly Lin), who, while Chinese, speaks fluent Japanese and runs a video store that rents films from Japan. Through a series of bloody encounters that take place across Asia, the assassins find themselves both allies and enemies, their rivalry culminating in fateful showdown. With ‘Fulltime Killer’ Johnnie To, a specialist of action cinema whose heterogeneous work oscillates between the grotesque (The Heroic Trio) and the minimalist (The Mission), has co-directed a crazed, exciting homage to the ‘bullet ballet’ sub-genre, laden with self-reflexive references and illogical narrative leaps. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Full fathom five
results.brief_description: A study of marine life, taken from the best footage of four outstanding underwater photographers. There is no narrative, instead the film is accompanied by electronic rock music.

results.title: Full cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
With the present shortage of fuel in Britain, the bicycle has come into its own as a humane machine, efficient, and adaptable alike for work or pleasure. This general film on cycling shows the manufacture of bicycles, bicycle competitions, riding and safety.

results.title: Full circle: the work of Doris Chase
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Wood, Perspective Films and Doris Chase
results.brief_description: Documentary on painter, sculptor and filmmaker, Doris Chase. Ms Chase explains her work including the development of her sculptural furnishings for modern dance groups into video film works.

results.title: Full Circle (Oil)
results.creator_credit: W.M. Larkins Studio and Peter Sachs
results.brief_description: Shows the improved services and other benefits that oil brings to the backward territories. The financial and technical resources of foreign lands have tapped the liquid wealth hidden below the surface of the earth. In return a new prosperity and improved standard of living is being brought to the peoples of those formerly barren lands.

results.title: Full circle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merry Go-Round, Sex Education. - Part 3.”.
A film for eight to ten year old children which answers the question “How does the baby begin?”. An explanation of intercourse and fertilization is given, the former using drawn silhouette figures of a man and a woman, the latter through animated drawings of sperm fertilizing the egg. The second half of the programme is about parental care.

results.title: Full ahead Rhine
results.brief_description: Follows the journey of three of the thousands of barges which ply regularly up and down the Rhine and its tributaries. Describes some of the main towns, Dusseldorf, Cologne, Stuttgart Ludwighaven, and the industries of the areas surrounding the waterways, including coal mining, iron, steel, chemical, and primary industries.

results.title: Full ahead
results.creator_credit: Chris Stewart, Pacific Films and Roger Mirams
results.brief_description: Shows the fleet of the Australian National Line at work, shipping distant raw materials to centres of secondary industry. Forty-four ships call at fifty-three ports, some being specially fitted to carry a particular bulk cargo, such as semi-trailers on the ‘Bass Trader’. Cargo carried includes ironstone from Yampi Sound, softwoods from Stanley, and raw sugar from Townsville. Practical training of the crew is carried out on board under the captain’s supervision.
